page.title: 10GLAZELEY CHURCH.
page.content: }The church is about{3.5}miles from Bridgnorth, and was rebuilt in 1875 to replace a much older building. There are two beautiful{brasses}in the church which are over 450 years old.In the graveyard there is a monument for local people killed in the{first World War.}The vicar is{Rev. {Davies}who also is vicar of several other local Parishes, such as Chetton. The brasses are of Thomas Wilde & his wife who were{killed}by their son. Their relatives laid the brasses in their memory in 1599. The nearby{altar}is made of marble with a green beize cloth laid over it. In the{graveyard}there are some odd gravestones.One is a triangular shape with a cross on the top.
